alert.note: Alert for Brown; Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 23 at 12:31AM MDT until September 23 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... James River near Stratford affecting Spink and Brown Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River near Stratford. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Significant amounts of agricultural lands begin flooding * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 AM CDT Friday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 AM CDT Friday was 14.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 13.4 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued this evening by 700 PM CDT.
